marketNews.title: US Manufacturing and Employment Data Weak
marketNews.content:
Several US economic data were released on Friday local time (1/11) with weak results. The data released were the Purchasing Managers Index (PMI) and nonfarm payroll (NFP) – employment outside the agricultural sector.

- PMI below 50, US manufacturing contracted for 7 months. The Institute for Supply Management (ISM) reported that the PMI for October 2024 fell to 46.5 (vs September 2024: 47.2), the lowest since July 2023. This indicates contraction in the manufacturing sector for seven consecutive months. The weak data were attributed to a Boeing workers strike.

- NFP growth fell, lowest since December 2020. The US Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) reported NFP of +12,000 in October 2024. This is far below the average increase of +194,000 over the previous 12 months and the economists' expectation of +113,000 based on a Reuters survey. This also marks the lowest growth since December 2020. The weak NFP growth in October 2024 was caused by reduced jobs in manufacturing and professional and business services. The weak NFP data were also driven by storms Helene and Milton. The Boeing strike also acted as a strong catalyst for the data weakening. This resulted in the unemployment rate in October 2024 remaining flat at 4.1% (vs September 2024: 4.1%). In addition, the BLS also revised down August NFP growth to +78,000 (-51%) and September to +223,000 (-12%), both down 112,000 from previous reports.

The NFP data is the last crucial data released before the official US election period begins. Nevertheless, surveys still show incumbent Harris ahead of Trump in the upcoming US election. According to the National Polling Average by The New York Times/Siena College (3/11), Harris leads 49% (vs Trump: 48%). Sentiment for Harris's victory is also supported by five other surveys.

In response to the data, the probability of a Fed rate cut of -50 bps by the end of 2024 as of Monday (4/11) rose to 82% (vs 28/10: 69%), based on the CME FedWatch Tool. The US dollar index (DXY) weakened -0.47% to 103.8 and the 10-year US Treasury yield fell -9 bps to 4.29%.

Key Takeaway

The weak US economic data increase the probability of US rate cuts by -25 bps each in November and December. This is reflected by the increase in the probability of a rate cut in the last week by 4 percentage points in November to 99.8% and by 12 percentage points in December to 81.5%.

The US rate-cut sentiment could provide room for rupiah appreciation and further monetary easing by Bank Indonesia. According to Bloomberg consensus as of 4 November 2024, BI is expected to cut rates by at least -25 bps by year-end 2024, same as the expectation on 7 October.

Indonesia 10-year government bond yield fell -3 bps week-over-week to 6.79% today (4/11). However, the rupiah continued to weaken -0.18% week-over-week to 15,753 per US dollar.

marketNews.title: Indonesia policy updates
marketNews.content:
Reuters reported that the Indonesian government will revise the foreign exchange earnings from natural resource exports (DHE-SDA) rule by extending the mandatory placement period for exporters. The amendment aims to increase domestic foreign exchange supply amid continued pressure on the rupiah in recent weeks. Currently, DHE-SDA under Government Regulation No. 36/2023 requires exporters to keep 30% of DHE-SDA in the domestic financial system for a minimum of three months.

The government will extend the corporate income tax holiday incentive for pioneer industries that invest in Indonesia until December 2025. However, recipients of the tax holiday will still pay a 15% corporate income tax in line with the upcoming global minimum tax. Investment Minister and Head of the Investment Coordinating Board, Rosan Roeslani, said the government can still provide incentives to related companies in other forms. Rosan noted that the tax holiday program has contributed more than 25% to Indonesia’s investment realization.

State-owned enterprises (BUMN) Minister Erick Thohir expressed optimism that the BUMN dividend payout target for 2025 of 90 trillion rupiah can be achieved. This target is higher than the 2024 APBN target of 85.54 trillion rupiah.

Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartanto said the government will extend tax incentives, including for the housing sector and electric vehicles, until next year. The extension of value-added tax (PPN-DTP) and luxury goods sales tax (PPnBM-DTP) incentives has not been detailed regarding budget size or quota. Airlangga stated the policy aims to boost consumer purchasing power to support significant economic growth.

Agriculture Minister Andi Amran Sulaiman announced that the government has prepared three dairy farm sites covering 92 hectares for Vietnamese investors. The three sites will be located in Central Sulawesi, South Kalimantan, and South Sulawesi, with the site in Poso, Central Sulawesi already reviewed together with the Vietnamese company TH Group.

The German automaker Volkswagen’s workers council said Volkswagen plans massive layoffs, plant closures, and salary cuts. The council indicated that at least three plants in Germany will be closed and tens of thousands of employees will be dismissed.

tickerNews.title: ACES: PT Kawan Lama Sejahtera purchases 16.9 million shares
tickerNews.content: $ACES: PT Kawan Lama Sejahtera bought 16.9 million shares of ACES at an average price of 905 rupiah per share on 28 October 2024. The total transaction value reached 15.3 billion rupiah. After the transaction, PT Kawan Lama Sejahtera’s ownership in ACES increased from 59.9% to 60%.

tickerNews.title: DILD: Director sells 260 million shares
tickerNews.content: $DILD: Director General of Intiland Development, Hendro S Gondokusumo, sold 260 million shares of DILD at an average price of 200 rupiah per share on 29 October 2024. The total transaction value reached 52 billion rupiah and was intended for investment divestment. After the transaction, Hendro S Gondokusumo’s ownership in DILD fell from 2.51% to 0%.

tickerNews.title: HEAL: Director purchases approximately 8 million shares
tickerNews.content: $HEAL: Director of Medikaloka Hermina, Yulisar Khiat, bought about 8 million shares of HEAL at an average price of 1,549 rupiah per share between 15 and 28 October 2024. The total transaction value was approximately 12.3 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Yulisar’s ownership in HEAL increased from 12.56% to 12.61%.

tickerNews.title: DMAS: Puradelta Lestari signs 1.5 trillion rupiah credit facility with BMRI
tickerNews.content: $DMAS: Puradelta Lestari signed a credit facility agreement worth 1.5 trillion rupiah from Bank Mandiri (BMRI) on 30 October 2024. The facility will be used for development in the Deltamas area, West Java, over a five-year period from signing.

tickerNews.title: MUTU: Afda Ekselensi Lintas Dunia sells 100 million shares
tickerNews.content: $MUTU: Controlling shareholder Mutuagung Lestari, PT Afda Ekselensi Lintas Dunia, sold 100 million shares of MUTU at an average price of 85 rupiah per share on 24 October 2024. The total transaction value reached 8.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Afda Ekselensi Lintas Dunia’s ownership in MUTU decreased from 10.5% to 7.32%.

tickerNews.title: SMAR: Interim dividend of 301.6 billion rupiah announced
tickerNews.content: $SMAR: Sinar Mas Agro Resources and Technology announced an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to 301.6 billion rupiah, or 105 rupiah per share. The dividend is payable on 11 November 2024 to shareholders on the regular and negotiation markets, with payment on 20 November 2024. Based on SMAR’s share price on Monday (4/11) at 4,250 rupiah, the implied dividend yield is approximately 2.5%.

tickerNews.title: FILM: Acquires 80.05% of NETV
tickerNews.content: $FILM: MD Entertainment completed the acquisition of 80.05% of Net Visi Media (NETV) at an execution price of 50 rupiah per share on 25 and 29 October 2024. The total transaction value reached 1.7 trillion rupiah. Previously, FILM had announced the acquisition plan on 28 August 2024.
